seriesStmt

seriesStmtseries statement groups information about the series, if any, to which a publication belongs.
Moduleheader â€” The TEI header
Attributes
  • att.global ( @xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space ) (att.global.rendition ( @rend, @style, @rendition ) ) (att.global.linking ( @corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select ) ) (att.global.analytic ( @ana ) ) (att.global.facs ( @facs ) ) (att.global.change ( @change ) ) (att.global.responsibility ( @cert, @resp ) ) (att.global.source ( @source ) )

    Example
    <seriesStmt> <title>Machine-Readable Texts for the Study of Indian Literature</title> <respStmt> <resp>ed. by</resp> <name>Jan Gonda</name> </respStmt> <biblScope unit="volume">1.2</biblScope> <idno type="ISSN">0 345 6789</idno> </seriesStmt>
    bibliography
    Content model<content> <alternate> <classRef key="model.pLike" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <sequence> <elementRef key="title" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <alternate minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <elementRef key="editor"/> <elementRef key="respStmt"/> </alternate> <alternate minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <elementRef key="idno"/> <elementRef key="biblScope"/> </alternate> </sequence> </alternate> </content>
